snippet: Federal authorities identified Nakoula Basseley Nakoula as part of the network that produced an online video that has drawn violent protests across the Middle East.
abstract: Federal authorities identify gas station owner Nakoula Basseley Nakoula as part of a network of people involved in creating the incendiary video that mocks Islam and that has drawn violent protests across the Middle East at United States embassies and consulates.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Serge F. Kovaleski from New York. Reporting was contributed by Michael Cieply and Ana Facio-Krajcer from Los Angeles; Ian Lovett from Cerritos, Calif.; Lea Lion from Duarte, Calif.; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Andrea Elliott from New York. Jack Begg contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: Federal authorities identified Nakoula Basseley Nakoula as part of the network that produced an online video that has drawn violent protests across the Middle East.

headline.seo: Film Backer Nakoula Basseley Nakoula Has Shadowy Past
headline.main: Man of Many Names Is Tied to a Video
headline.print_headline: Man of Many Names Is Tied to a Video
